intro: Ipomoea meeusei, commonly known as the Meeuse's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and climbers. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Ipomoea meeusei is typically found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
